review_title: Mystery of this film is Why Was It Made?
review_detailed_main:
500 years of progress and this is what we have to show for it?

It really feels like nobody wanted to make this movie but someone made them do it. Nobody had anything to say. Anything to add. Nothing we haven't seen a million times before. Screenplay has nothing whatsoever to say or convey and is full of clichés, just like it would be if you never wanted to write it in the first place, but had to. For a grade, or something.

Clearly, there was no excess money to burn - almost entire scenography is some kind of paintball course. And some forest. And all the crops are close-ups of people doing stuff, mostly shooting off into something offscreen, presumably into the distance.

The movie is set in the 26th century, with the space and time bending human species spanning three planets (only indication of this is an introductory text) and the weirdest thing we can see in the galaxy is a girl with semi-yellow hair? Everything else, technology, weapons, fashion, everything looks exactly as today. Alright, excepting a few seconds long filler scenes of spaceships.

I'm writing this because one question baffles me without cease. It's - Why did you have to make this? What was the motivation behind this work? I don't see you making any money, however inadequate the investment was. What's the point? I'd really like to know.

If this is some kind of student project movie, then its kinda cool. If you go to school with the guys who made this then you should really have a go at it. Otherwise...

review_title: I think they spent all the budget on Bruce Willis and had nothing left for writing, props, actors and more.
review_detailed_main:
I noticed that "Cosmic Sin" recently made it to IMDB's infamous Bottom 100 list and has a pitiful score of only 2.5! So, not only is it on the list...but it is way up the list at #39!

When I first started watching this sci-fi film, I could IMMEDIATELY see why the film is so hated. It's a film set in the 26th century and at this time, there is space travel and life on many planets and moons. So, why do you see folks driving pickup trucks that look like they are from 2021? Why are the clothes pretty much what you'd see today and why are most of the weapons not much more effective or different than today's?! It honestly looks like they must have spend all their budget on securing Bruce Willis' talents and had nothing left to make it look like a futuristic story. Now I don't think you need expensive props to make a good film...but this is ridiculous and really takes you out of the story.

The story begins with some form of life being discovered on some new planet. It seems that up until this time, humans have never made first contact with any intelligent species...even with humans inhabiting many new worlds. As you'd expect, this new form of sentient life is not sweet and friendly....as who would want to see a film like that?! And, it turns out that it is so deadly that in the entire galaxy (numbering many, many, many billions) the only guy that can stop the creatures is a war criminal, James Ford (Willis)!

I have seen much worse films that never made it to the IMDB list...mostly because they are older, cheaper and more obscure. In other words, the Bottom 100 is very heavily skewed to new films...so although the film is bad, it's not the 39th worst film ever made! I think it's just that a lot of folks get Netflix and had a chance to see it...whereas far less folks have seen the films of Ed Wood, Al Adamson, Ray Dennis Steckler and William Grefe...all filmmakers who REALLY knew how to make terrible films...REALLY terrible films!

So is there anything good about this movie? Some of the CGI space scenes are very nice and would probably look great on the big screen (though I assume this film, when it came out, only went straight to Netflix and Amazon Prime). Otherwise, the story is not especially interesting, the dialog often pretty bad and the acting not especially good. It is not completely awful...just mostly awful. And, unfortunately not so bad that it's fun to watch in order to make fun of the film.

By the way, nearly all the reviews for this are extremely negative. With this and a score of 2.5, I am amazed to find some folks giving it 10s! A few admit that it's bad but are just trolling or love it because it's so bad. A few, however, are VERY short reviews that talk about how brilliant it is...a sure sign normally of fake reviews done by folks connected with the film...which is pretty shameful.

A terribly written trash heap that made no sense, the storyline was disjointed to say the least. The effects were okay. But what good there was is overshadowed by poor acting and bad dialogue. Almost laughably bad.

Bruce Willis stopped telegraphing his acting for this film. He just didn't act at all. I mean, it looked like he was between high and mentally disabled. I worry about the dude. Then Frank Grillo, happenstance makes that I have seen three of his films this week, I was just saying how I wish he would get a break. Not for this film! Note that he is billed first, above Willis, and his role is at most 15 minutes from the film anyway.

But what makes this film shine like a black hole is the story. It felt more than devoid of passion, like a spreadsheet that sucks one's soul away in the accounting department on a hot day after the air conditioning died. I mean, if a kid would have written it, it at least would have been fun. If someone was incompetent it would have felt like trying to send some kind of message, however badly. But no, it ... just made no sense, like someone hated writing for this film.

Bottom line: it is so bad you can't even enjoy it wasted. It's a non-movie. It's like what's on the other side of the event horizon of TV static.
I have no words to describe how truly awful this movie is. Best part of the movie is the backing music to the credits.

If you're a scifi fan like me you probably read the premise and be quite interested. Bruce Willis wasn't anything positive or negative for me but I thought it would be a sign of a high quality movie. Well... I watched the first 30 Minutes of this and... it's bad. Like really bad. It's not like this one thing in it is bad like for example the plot is a bit weak. But when you're at the point where even I critique the cinematography and color grading you have to be at a very low point to the degree of college-first-indie-movie-attempts-bad. This is usually stuff I can overlook quite easily because I don't notice.

This film basically has everything bad a film can have. From every category. Take your pick what you think is the worst.

review_title: It is beyond me, how something like this gets released. Awful.
review_detailed_main: It is seldom that one comes across a movie with so little to give. There are dozens of shoot'em up games out there with better storylines more engaging dialogue, better graphics and acting. Bruce Willis probably has better commercials out there. Stay away. Keep away. Not worth it even in fast forward.

review_title: Very cheaply made and made little sense

review_detailed_main:
Wow, simply spectacular. One of the best sci fi movies ever made, and probably Bruce willis top performance to date. Makes you watch this movie again, again, and again.

Spoiler Alert: Why should I suffer alone

A pretty decent b-movie, ten years ago this was on the same quality level as many blockbuster. I think the score is so low because many had rated the movie for Willis, before knowing these were the last shots (as we found later, he cannot act properly due to sickness).

Back to the movie, we could say it is not innovative in any way, but it contains many of the pattern we usually find in this kind of movies. The guy, the strong woman, the heroe, the bad enemy, the final monster, the good guy some died breaking everyone heart, the guy who had to sacrifice himself, and so on.

But I think the special effects were pretty decent and with some good ideas (compared to the budget).

So I wrote my minimum 600 chars to say: give the movie a chance and enjoy the last sparkle of a star.

Really wanted to like this as I love scifi movies especially anything involving aliens, I'm thinking, supposed to be 500 years into the future but the fellas still driving a 4x4, i got to the bar scene, and I thought, this looks like roadhouse, (albeit no where near as good) warning signs of a crappy film start to kick in. 90 percent of the movie was just people talking random s#*t, practically no action whatsoever, and by the time we were down to the last 20 muinites I gave up! Dont know what Bruce Willis has been thinking last couple of movies he's been in, All I'm looking for is a movie that'll rival Independence Day form 1996, it's been nearly 25 years and still nothing! Avoid this if you value your time on this earth, absolute garbage.

Some 500 years in the future, mankind has spread into the cosmos. On a faraway planet, humans have encountered First Contact. An alien presence infects people and turns them into marauding zombies. James Ford (Bruce Willis) is a disgraced military leader arguing for the doomsday Q-bomb. Engineer Fiona Ardene (Adelaide Kane) is called in to prep the device. General Ryle (Frank Grillo) leads the soldiers while Dr. Lea Goss (Perrey Reeves) is awed by the aliens.

First thing first, this movie opens with an info-dump in text form. It's a lot of gobbledygook. Someone should try to read it again. Then there is the awkward mix of present-day technology with the future tech. There is no logical reason for it. It's an obviously sign of bad budgeting and unimaginative set design. When that happens, they are better off putting the movie in a smaller space and as much future tech onto the screen. At least, put some effort in giving the characters some future-cars. Its greater sin is that it's boring. I think I must have spaced out. One moment, they're fighting zombies in the warehouse and the next, they're space-diving to another planet. It's a forgettable muddle.
This was total trash. Don't waste your time. It's not even bad enough to make you laugh. The people who participated in this farce should be jailed for wasting peoples time.

review_title: I think less of myself for having watched this.
review_detailed_main:
The Blood General? That is totally made up by a twelve year old boy.

What an idiot firing so many rounds into darkness.

2500 something and people are still driving the same cars?!

There were two people on the whole planet abs now you have several more than that survivors?! Is counting a lost skill in 2500 something?!

They weren't tipped off my their face and eyes?!

2500 something has no laser or pulse guns?

They may be in hibernation.

Aliens with hoods is an easy way to cut costs, and disappoint the audience.

What the hell was that scene?! It made no science?! Bruce walks into a cage having hallucinations and surrounded by aliens, then the specialist appears and they walk through the woods?! F-n terrible.

This is another example of what 1.25 speed was made for... maybe 1.5 speed.

That general sidekick side conversation was pointless... as was his conversation with the little girl. Trying to inject some humanity in a dump truck of garbage.

They ran out of "armor" so they told a guy on set with a flannel shirt to grab a toy gun.

This can't end quick enough.

All the kids shots hit the armor... why is he dead?

This was a complete waste of money.

Grillo got the best deal out of this, he had the least screen time.

There is not even a single good line in this film.

What kind of armor leaves the midsection wide open?

Why is there a flashing open sign inside!!!

review_title: Bruce takes another B trash dive

review_detailed_main: What an epic disappointment this turned out to be. Dire acting, unconnected plot. As mentioned there is a large percentage of nothing happening in this movie. The aliens were nothing of note. Special effects were lacking. I thought Bruce Willis was going to save the movie but he gave up in the first bar scene. Mankind did not deserve to win in tjis one. Come on writers, stop using the angry young soldier stamping his feet routine as it made me want to stop watching more than the slow pace.

I watched this film because I'm in the mood for sci-fi, aliens and Bruce Willis. Oh, and because of IMDB's rating of 2.5! I've always avoided the low rated ones but my curiosity got the better of me this time. I'm glad it did, too!

Yes, it's obvious the money wasn't used for production value, a great storyline or snazzy dialog. All the critics are right about that. But, I thought the actors did their best with what they had. Especially Bruce Willis! He was laid back and snarky as usual. I love that guy! The aliens really got screwed in wardrobe. That was too bad.

I enjoyed this movie and I bet you will too. Relax, kick back with a drink and your favorite movie snack.

Granted, I have to admit that I was lured in to watching the 2021 movie "Cosmic Sin" given the movie's cover/poster and the fact that the movie was starring Bruce Willis, Frank Grillo and Costas Mandylor.

And let me just come right out and say that writers Edward Drake and Corey Large failed to deliver a wholesome movie here with "Cosmic Sin". While I managed to sit through the entire ordeal, then I must say that all throughout the course of the entire movie I was sitting with an overwhelming sense of pointlessness. I just couldn't find anything worthwhile in the storyline, and everything seemed just bland and without a cause.

It was so difficult to indulge myself into the storyline because it was so linear and anything but interesting and exciting. So the end result that is "Cosmic Sin" from director Edward Drake was just a very forgettable and rather mundane movie. The storyline was just so amazingly generic and linear that you could have left the movie for a longer period of time, and returned only to be right up to speed with the storyline.

Now, I am sure that die-hard fans - pardon the pun - of Bruce Willis or Frank Grillo might actually find some kind of odd enjoyment here in the movie. I, however, didn't. So this movie was a swing and a miss.

I must admit that it felt that Bruce Willis wasn't really committed to this movie project, and his performance felt half-hearted, as if he was running on auto-pilot. And Frank Grillo just wasn't given enough on-screen time to manage to do much of anything to salvage the movie.

The characters in the movie were every bit as bland and pointless as the storyline. So you don't really connect with any of them, nor do you form any kind of attachments to any of them. So whether they live or die, it hardly matters.

Now, what did work for "Cosmic Sin" was the visuals. They had some nice enough suits for the soldiers of the Alliance. And the weapon effects were quite good. The aliens, however, they just felt like something out of a B movie. So that was disappointing to say the least.

All in all, "Cosmic Sin" was exactly what the movie title says; a cosmic sin. This movie came and went without leaving much of any blast mark or memorable impression. My rating of "Cosmic Sin" lands on a mere three out of ten stars.
... Bruce Willis is jealous of Nicholas Cage career.
I was waiting for somebody to make a cut and tell that this is just a joke.

Its a low budget C/D title (or was this some kind of a fan film?, not really sure) with Bruce Willis. Do not expect any interesting shoot outs, fight scenes or effects, story is... lets call it "simple". Couldnt watch it in one go, found myself escaping the torture every couple of minutes. Acting aligned with the simple cliche story so do not expect anything in that area as well. Very little character back story and universe lore, characters are shallow and aliens are just simple strange looking cannon fodder with high tech appearing randomly, talking some brief non sense here and there and doing silly stuff before they are shot. Sound was okay I guess for a low budget... thats why I gave it 2.

I think anyone can guess how it ends in the first 5 minutes so not even bothering to put a spoiler here. If there was one thing surprising, its that Bruce didnt do 99% of the killing, that came really unexpected.

review_title: Low ratings are in this case completely justified.
review_detailed_main: Bruce Willis is becoming the new Nicholas Cage. It looks like he's just accepting any role without reading the script, something Nicholas Cage seems to do as well. Not that I think Bruce Willis is a great actor, he just played in some good movies, but he's not a great actor, and lately he's been actually really bad. It's going downhill for Bruce Willis. Cosmic Sin is just bad, with a story that is badly written, special effects that looked from another century, and actors that don't seem to know what they're doing. I wish I could unwatch this piece of garbage.

review_title: This garbage really is a cosmic sin
review_detailed_main:
Its so excruciatingly bad. Its the most generic cliched garbage you can imagine. Bad acting, bad story, bad casting, bad cgi, bad filming, bad editing... all of it is bad.

Its honestly worth watching the first 30 minutes just to get a sense of how bad a movie can really get.

review_title: Worst Sci Fi I've seen in years and I love Sci Fi

review_detailed_main:
This movie had made my day! I laughed long and hard ... and I honestly, considered creating a "go fund me " page for Bruce, because the guy needs to be in some serious financial hardship since he agreed to stare in this glut. The " he was going to die anyway" scene is a ultimate proof that a good movie is not only made by good actors... Spaceballs is like a an Iliad of space movies when compared to this abomination. Hats down for anyone who can make it past 30 min mark.

This movie is so bad! So bad I dedicated 15 min of my life to create this account and post this review! Unbelievable!

1 out of 5 stars.

Cosmic Sin is a horrible science fiction action film. The cast ensemble performances are horrible and phoned in. Looking for an easy paycheck. The visual effects are terrible. The action is boring. The story is terrible. The script and direction is terribly put together.

review_title: So far the worst movie of 2021
review_detailed_main:
I know Covid is out and the actors got hard times to get a job, but this is by faaaaaar the worst movie Bruce Willis ever done.

This will easy get him an good score at Rotten Tomatoes.

review_title: Worse than you can possibly imagine
review_detailed_main: Can anyone remember when you could give more than 3 out of 10 to a Bruce Willis movie. This movie is just as bad as his last several films but with a budget less than fan fiction YouTube film. It's really that bad, I'm guessing 99% of the budget went on paying its 2 main stars.

review_title: This sci-fi has the budget of my last KFC run.
review_detailed_main: This sci-fi has the budget of my last KFC run. But hey, you can tell it is set 500 years in the future because it has neon lights. Bruce Willis and Frank "How the Hell Did I get Famous" Grillo are tantamount to cardboard cutouts in this cheap nothing-burger. I have already forgotten the plot... and I watched it ten minutes ago.

I see Bruce Willis and I generally think 'action flick, but might be good'... Ohhhh how wrong was I. The only thing good about this movie is the 'idea' behind it. Everything else is just so, so bad! The acting, the dialog, the "action", the plastic/paper weapons, the reaction of characters, the story building its all just so bad. I registered my account on IMBD just to write this review, that is how bad this movie was.

Please do not waste your life. You might have dreams, do not let this thing crush them! Go and live, spend time with your family have some fun, but for the love of everything that is good DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE!
I never wanted a movie to end so quick! I can't believe this movie is from 2021.
All I got to say is don't watch because its a complete waste of your life.

review_title: Works only as a warning to film students on what NOT to do...

review_detailed_main:
I truly wonder if all the negative reviews are from bots? How can someone be so critical of a pretty enjoyable movie that has a lot of very nicely done scenes and characters. The dialogues and characters I felt were genuine and realistic one might even say noble!

Bruce Willis steals the show definitely, but more importantly the director didn't make the movie from one character's point of view, it's indeed from a truly narrative point of view. Which I liked very much. Might be in the same league as Battlestar Galactica, but some profound dialogues with a different focus.

Very good movie.

It's a low budget sci-fi film but it has an excellent cast and I liked some of the scenes, I think they did well with the low budget and it was a lot better than the other Bruce Willis sci-fi anti-life.

review_title: Can't justify anyone seeing this movie.
review_detailed_main:
Bruce Willis does this sometimes, it's one of those cheap flicks in which they spend a lot of money to have Mr. Willis spend 10,mins in the movie so they can put him on the poster and say Bruce Willis is in the movie, so that...Die Hard fans like myself will check it out.

I'm hip to the con and sometimes it leads to a good movie. In this case I at least thought I would get Frank Grillo as the actual star of the movie but as it turns out he's also phoning this one with Willis. Guest he can do that after making that money In the Marvel Cinematic Universe flicks.

The movie has a complex plot about survival of the fittest on an interstellar level, which was pretty much wrapped up in the trailer of the film and never really goes any further.

I would love to tell you how action packed this film is but that falls short as well. It feels set up to be fluffed with action but its all lame .

The only thing I truly got a kick out of was the cheap Sci-fi. You could tell they were trying to turn 20 bucks into 200 million, but sometimes those failures can give a movie charm. They had some visual effects scenes that were filmed perfectly and some of the costumes were so stylish i could not keep my eyes off of them (Making it easier to see all their flaws)

If you want a really good Bruce Willis is just on the poster movie checkout Extraction, it's perfect. I would leave this one alone.
I usually watch this kind of movies for a good laugh, but this one didn't even give me that little pleasure. I almost feel sorry for everyone who participated in this useless endeavor.

I was hoping this movie could deliver an interesting story. The low budget is obvious from the trailer, and the cheesy dialog and bad acting can be seen miles away. But low budget, poorly directed movies can have entertaining and compelling stories, and I like to find those.

This is not it. If you think there is any redeemable quality for this movie, because Bruce Willis must have seen something to be in it, you'd be wrong. I don't know why he agreed to be in this film, but the script was not.

The movie is full of cliches, but the worst part is that it doesn't make any sense. All is supposed to happen in less than 24 hours, yet the movie has characters and events that seem to have happened for decades. The mismatch of technological advances is ludicrous, with rifles with ammo alongside lasers, and gas vehicles with wormhole jumps.

Absurd beyond believe, there is a pocket sized weapon capable of destroying an entire solar system. Unstable, it can't be rattled and can be activated if dropped. The encasing of this technological marvel of 500 years into the future? A glass cylinder. Not even a cardboard box with padding like an iPhone.

The inconsistencies are so profound and frequent, that I truly started to worry about my own understanding. Am I having a stroke? How can this have passed through a team of people and nobody said anything?

But it is not me. This movie is really that bad. Like a word salad of low budget sci fy scenes cobbled up together by a defective algorithm.

Don't waste your time.

This film is just a mess. I hope that the intention behind this was to make some easy cash. Otherwise, I just can't explain why would anyone get involved in this.

There are outlines of a story, but not like an actual screenplay. The time setting makes no sense, the WORLD BUILDING that is done through on-screen text doesn't seem to mean anything. The science is messed up beyond even the lowest fiction standards of science fiction. I think I had a general understanding of what was supposed to be going on, but I'm not sure.

At times it felt almost like a bad parody, and I hope they were just trolling the viewers with just how much they can get away with.

It looks like a fan film shot on a good camera with good actors but nobody cared one bit.

I can't really bash on the actors, everyone needs some cash, there were a couple of recognizable faces like Frank Grillo (who isn't a pro actor, but he's always likable), Lochlyn Munro, even Costas Mandylor from the Saw series...this is just...bizarre.

Willis delivered his basic nearly-coma performance which he does in most of his fast paycheck-oriented films now, and he made sure that the contract mentioned him in the script as an ultimate badass. His appearance was obviously agreed on only to have his face mentioned in the promotion materials.

I usually endorse low-budget sci-fi when I see a spark of an idea or actual care put into one. This is an absolute waste of time, I strongly recommend everyone to skip this.

Bruce is the New Nicolas Cage.

This is a trash movie. Dont waste time on it.

Cosmic Sin is how Steven Speilberg would have directed movie.... if he was a baby. Maybe not. Any baby can make a movie better than this. Because this is a disgusting garbage that should not exist in humanity.

Bruce Willis is the star of this. Every scene he is in he looks tired and bored. Poor Bruce. Can't imagine working in a set of this film. Guess he just wants to pay some bills.

There are also other 'actors' in Cosmic Sin. But none of them knows what is called acting. There are even frequent close-up shots of actors just to show how terrible their performances are.

Words can't describe how boring and boring this movie is. The plot isn't even interesting to begin with. It's amazing how 88 minutes can feel that long.

Everytime you think this movie is ending it gives you more scenes. NO. You will find yourself begging for it to end.

Go grab some snacks to eat instead. I find my self more entertained by eating the bag of chips in my hand than staring at this pathetic motion picture. Or if you want to look your TV for 88 minutes about a movie with nothing watchable, enjoy.

review_title: Skip it or Stream it? the answer is .....
review_detailed_main: SKIP it!!!!!! dont waste your time and bandwidth... this movie is really bad in terms of acting and plot!! Sooooooo bad that I walked out from my own house!

review_title: Does this writer/director team have something on Bruce or is it all some kind of tax write off thing?
review_detailed_main:
Breach was really bad, this is no better and we've got two more pairings of this dynamic team to look forward to later this year I see.

To be fair some of the effects in this are good and you can see the actors trying their best. But already wearing restrictive paintballing gear and having to pretend that their badly fitting space 'helmets' actually fit something in the 'suit up' sequence really is the height of comedy.

All the ingredients are here to make a half way decent film but somehow nobody quite managed it. Again.
I favorite part was the ending and I could go to the bathroom to pee.

Bruce Willis is never tired ! I liked this movie as I like his previous.

I don't understand the negative reviews.

review_title: A lot of people say this movie is bad.. Let me tell you why..
review_detailed_main:
Before I start with the review, Let me tell you how I and my brother approached this movie, Critics said this movie is bad, Everybody said this movie is bad, As am I writing this review rn is has a rating of 2.5 outta 10 (yikes).. So basically everyone said this movie is bad and WE KNEW THAT.

Me and my brother love watching bad movies, Sometimes when a movie fails at every aspect of being a decent product It can be super entertaining, Movies like The Room, Troll 2, I will even go as far to say that Suicide Squad is one of my favorite movies because of how hilariously awful it is.. Unfortunately this movie wasn't...

Cosmic Bin is one of most boring bad movies I have EVER SEEN!

The story is the most generic sci fi fantasy gebber gabber, Bruce Wills is a retired space soldier (or something like that) and the space military station want his stuntdoub~ I mean him, To do one last mission..

The action scenes are too boring and so far in between with unnecessary slow-motion with sound effects we have heard a thousand times before..

Characters so generic you won't even remember their names after the credits roll, Bruce Wills's character (James Ford, Such a creative name lol) kills one of soldier friends FOR NO APPARENT REASON.. and that's the character that we should love and sympathize with.. Oh yeah and Frank Grillo, The first guy in the credits, He barely appear in the movie (WOW, Such a great passion for movie making)

Don't watch this movie, It's super boring, Full of filler and pointless scenes, Bad acting / custom design, Uninspired music and It's not even funny, Avoid this movie at all costs..

I no longer fear death because I have seen Cosmic Sin and what could possibly be worse? The biggest sin is that this steaming pile ever got made. Made my eyes bleed and I kept throwing up in my mouth. Saying it was bad is an insult to bad movies everywhere. I could actually feel brain cells dying as I sat through this abortion. I don't think I'll ever be able to drink enough to erase it from my memory. Best part of the whole movie was when it ended and the pain finally stopped. Shame on you Mr. Willis. Shame on You. If you have someone that you hate. I mean REALLY HATE tell them to watch Cosmic Sin. They will no longer want to live in a world where horrible things like this "movie" exists. Gotta go shower now and try to wash the stench of this atrocity off me.

review_title: How the F is this even rated 2.5?!!
review_detailed_main: This movie is terrible!!!! Actually I don't think we have made up a word that describes how bad this movie is. I would rather listen to "this is the song that doesn't end" over and over for eternity than watch this movie again. I would rather hang out with Barney and Blues Clues. I would rather sandpaper the a$$hole of an alligator in a phone booth. I still don't feel I have expressed myself enough on how much this movie was an utter disappointment. But that's all the energy I have left. I wasted the rest on hoping something would get better in this god awful movie!!!!!
I didnt belive for the people who sayd this is the worst movie in the year or era. But now i belive. This is. Dont waste your time. Its realy realy that bad.
If you have read any of the many lengthy negative reviews you will only have gotten just a small inkling as to how bad this movie really is.

review_title: One of those 'Bruce Willis just can't say no' movies
review_detailed_main: I read that Bruce Willis only took a day of filming for this and the rest of it was stunt doubles, that doesn't bode well. He barely put a full sentence in. It had a cast capable of making something at least decent; Bruce Willis, Frank Grillo, Lochlyn Munro are some of the more known actors that you might have seen before but are usually hit or miss actors and this was a miss. The main problem was the writing though, the script was horrible and unimaginative. The plot and premise were unoriginal but okay, with a good enough script this would have been tolerable, maybe good if you wanna stretch. It's paced all wrong too, with some scenes and pauses going on too long for dramatic effect but it just made me wanna fast forward. The CGI was all bright and neon, quintessential of low budgets sci-fi movies and series to make them seem more futuristic. Also, the whole mysterious alien wormhole gate and a rogue team heading to stop it feels like a farce take on The Expanse. I'm surprised I watched the whole thing, but I think that's owing to heading into it with already low expectations and nothing better to do. Definitely not worth a watch. I've always wondered how directors feel after making a movie and it has a crappy ratings on every review platform.

Another atrocious offering from Bruce Willis. Everything about this film is garbage. The acting, the script, the direction. If you wish to spend an hour and a half more productively, rip off your clothing and roll in poison ivy.

review_title: Is that spacesuit made of colored plastic ?
review_detailed_main: If I could rate the movie under 0, I would do that

review_title: I wonder how much this movie 's budget is?

review_detailed_main: I liked it. People are a little to overly critical of scifi. Good flick give it a shot. Glad to see Bruce back in this genre

review_title: Had to make an account to warn you
review_detailed_main:
This is the worst movie I've ever seen, and I've seen a lot of garbage.

Not only is this film stupid, derivative and criminally badly done but for some reason they tried to make it about a very clumsy but very disturbing apology of genocide.

review_title: Were this a no budget film released on YouTube by some students for free I'd recommend it, but as a product by a professional studio with Bruce Willis in the lead it's trash.
review_detailed_main:
In the year 2524 an Earth colony has first contact with a hostile alien race. General Ryle (Frank Grillo) enlists disgraced "Blood General" James Ford (Bruce Willis) who was infamous for his use of a Q-Bomb that killed 70 Million people. Ryle enlists Ford to lead an off the books team to eliminate the alien threat before they're aloud to spread through the galaxy.

Reteaming with Edward Drake and Corey Large of fellow DtV Willis sci-fi film Breach, Cosmic Sin looks and feels like it's from the same filmmakers to the point they almost feel like entries in their own "universe". Instead of aping Alien or The Thing like Breach, Cosmic Sin is more in line with sci-fi action like Aliens or Edge of Tomorrow. In a way I suppose Cosmic Sin is a marginal improvement on Breach, but in other ways with a larger scale story and a similar production budget, it feels noticeably cheaper than Breach as well.

Much like Breach the movie doesn't feel like it takes place in the future. At least with Breach once they were on the ship they at least had proper uniforms that fit with the situation, but in Cosmic Sin everything feels like it's straight from today save for some CGI establishing shots of spaceships and some "armor"(we'll get to that). It's clear the movie's reach far exceeds it's grasp with the "high tech military facility" using the same tricks as breach to make it look futuristic with harsh multicolored lighting and poorly integrated hologram effects. But the filmmakers luckily decided to give us some locational variety with their shoot....the woods! All of the colony scenes (save for one scene with a tent) take place in the woods and have the same feeling of rushed and economic one would expect to see in a LARP straight out of Role Models. The armor the characters wear in the second half of the movie makes no sense as the script says it's approved for "quantum combat"(whatever that's supposed to be) and with open faced helmets and massive bare patches there's no thought or care as to how these cheap bulky monstrosities function in combat or space.

Outside of the bare bones production values, the movie's script is a hodgepodge of pretty much every other sci-fi film/video game you've seen(and a few you haven't) with the likes of the 2009 Star Trek, Stargate, Edge of Tomorrow, Screamers, Gears of War, Aliens, and even Ghosts of Mars. The movie's script also tries to address "ethical issues" in quite possibly the most ill fitting approach since 2005's Stealth tried to analyze the moral issues of unmanned drone warfare. Willis' "Blood General" James Ford is so named because he quelled an separatist rebellion by dropping a Q-bomb killing 70 million people. The movie is strangely uncritical about this character with many of the supporting cast spouting things about how Ford got a "Raw Deal", "It's harder to give orders than follow them", "you need monsters to beat monsters", and it's the kind of mindset that many villains use for justification in many films of this ilk that makes the film feel fundamentally confused. Not that the story will draw most people in as it's poorly delivered with bad camera work, poorly staged sequences, and sleepy performances from uninterested actors with Bruce Willis' voice never even breaking an octave.

Cosmic Sin continues Bruce Willis' disappointing DtV streak with an embarrassing cheap sci-fi rehash that is put to shame by amateurly made fan productions. With a sloppy production, cut and paste script, and uninterested performances that leave the movie inert and dull the movie will give you the odd laugh or smirk from point out its stolen ideas and concepts, but aside from that it's yet another cheap dud from a once respectable actor.

review_title: The making of this movie was a 'Cosmic Sin'
A Faint Potential For A Engaging Sci Fi Movie Falls To Poor Writing and Execution
review_detailed_main:
In Cosmic Sin the 26th Century still using way outdated hand weapons (eventually even a grenade) and pick-up trucks and honking vehicles on a street and parked motorcycles and even cigarettes indistinguishable from the 1960s. The Nostromo from the Alien (1979) had a way much better med unit. Early scenes after the good and bad introductory mystery have of course the requisite robotic servers and hologram (country?) singers and a barfight with a slight difference with again the old-fashioned side arms and the Calvary with an attempt at twinge of an alternative outcome that really is not.

There are major storyline problems with the quarantine procedures even simple glass windows and even a typical "gun" fight, yet there was an initial attempt at fascinating underlying dynamic taking place however with the first contact encounter scenes and subsequent reflective commentary. Then somehow a brief firefight does not flow well, problems with editing arise, a scene very underdeveloped, and supposedly a well-manned defensive team becomes at risk of being actually overrun. Instead of a quickening climatic pace, the energy seems to dissipate and slow down along with almost no high-tech, futuristic surveillance networks to warn of impending attacks becomes more combat scenes from a mediocre World War II movie with elements from Stargate (1994) and worse yet the climatic battle is something that would be more like out of a World War I engagement and lame hand to hand sequences and a limp effort a riveting emotional end. The screenwriters were definitely not up the job and no actor could improve on a thin script that had the promise but not the actual substance to translate into a credible movie. This movie even reverted to absolutely unnecessary cowboy, western era musical harmonics while Bruce Willis strangely just seems to fade almost completely away by the end of the movie.

The major problem with Cosmic Sin lies with the screenwriters trying too hard to be cute and offer up something substance, different, and try to incorporate too many fancy relational and philosophical ideas. They failed in their execution and omitted too many important backstories to offer audiences a sense of plot flow. Instead the audience is sort of just dropped into this movie without the understanding of what the real motives of what is going on. The audience is forced to play catch up. The writers fall into their own traps with the only way out of empty ideas is to create overly convenient ways to extricate themselves out of various corners (i.e., where a general loses face for backing down on his own orders, the awkward political dynamics of the military decisions being made, past undisclosed relationships).

Maybe the only nice surprise of this movie is the character and what some people might call a cameo performance of Lochlyn Munro. He appears to have finally broken out of his typecast of either simple bad guy or side character in a slew of romantic comedies. Munro had a decent performance here.

review_title: I am a huge scifi and Bruce Willis fan. BUT...this scifi movie looks ridiculous and Bruce Willis is only present due to contractual obligations...

I AM (was) A BRUCE WILLIS FAN.

The "story": .....

Pfff... a 9 metacritics score, that is a new record low (before it was 12).

In my quest to see ALL Bruce Willis movies I also watched this one. Let's not forget that some of the movies Bruce Willis is making nowadays is only because of contractual obligations. That's the reason why he is churning out 5 till 10 movies a year upon year. That's a lot. Of course you cant be picky when you are starring in 10 movies a year. He often only stars in each movie for no more than 15 minutes or so. Producers happy, because they sell tickets with Bruce his name on the bill. Bruce Willis happy because he got his paycheck and can pay alimony to his ex-wives. But the audience watching it, might not be so happy, because they are expecting DIE HARD quality filmmaking. And to put it politely, some of these newest Bruce Willis movies are "a bit" inferior to DIE HARD.

At an (excrucially) important sidenote, let us not forget WHY we are watching Bruce Willis movies to begin with. We watch Bruce Willis movies because of DIE HARD (1988). THE ONE AND ONLY BIGGEST ACTION AMERICAN ACTION CLASSIC OF THE CENTURY.

This classic is still standing strong after more than 30 years. Millions of people still REwatch it during every Christmas holiday. Recently a petition was launched to rename Nakatomi Plaza into DIE HARD plaza.

A life time achievement award for Bruce Willis is in the making.

DIE HARD (1988) NEVER DIES but is still ALIVE AND KICKING IN 2022. Why not simply REwatch the brilliant DIE HARD (1988) again and start the new year with a bang! Happy New Year!

review_title: ANOTHER CHEAP 'N' CHEESY SCI-FI B-MOVIE WITH WILLIS!!!
review_detailed_main:
EDWARD DRAKE who directed this very low-budget t.v series like Sci-fi Thriller also had written it & also had written the other Bruce Willis Sci-fi Cheapy ANTI-LIFE (2021) also & that explains why both films are so similar & i thought that as I watching it, i actually said to my wife that Willis must've gotten Deya Vu making this!!! I actually liked ANTI-LIFE better of the two but to be honest they do make a chilled evening of a Double Bill of Willis Sci-fi Thriller's. Now COSMIC SIN is set like it's other half of the Double bill, in the future but this time the world isn't destroyed but just very futuristic (with what the small budget could do) with flying cars/vehicles as well as normal cars too still & robots for a barman in the bars (Similar to Will Smith's i,Robot 2004) & lots of glowing Neon lights & things & for the most part it looks good!!! Yes it's very low-budget but i gotta admit i was impressed with alot of the look & technology they pulled off with cheap c.g.i & practical effects & the basic story is our planet has finally made contact with Alien creatures but they're hostile & when a team return from another planet that they've been stationed on, they come back possessed just like in it's close brother ANTI-LIFE & start killing everyone in the station base & here we get our team of soon-to-be heroes with the rugged old infamous ex-Commander Bruce Willis known as a warmonger due to his brutal past & it's just nice having the old skool Action legend here in such a low-budget production, even if he's only here for the paycheck!!! Willis plays his part like most these days with a calmness & a Coolness & a bad attitude just like he did in Anti-life & many other of his DTV films but i like him here & just by having him lifts its quality. We also get the great B-movie legend FRANK GRILLO who i have loved since THE PURGE: ANARCHY & his Cool, rugged & no-nonsense toughness is on display again in a leader role but to be honest he doesn't get to do the action i expected & wanted but again it's great to have the veteran side by side with Willis. There's a few other familiar faces but it's these two stars is why i wanted to even watch this.

I will say this though that i would rather watch this flick or Anti-life over any of the ridiculously mega budget TRANSFORMERS films & more so than many of the over-blown budget trash that is put on the Cinema, Cosmic Sin is small scale but crams in a fun little Sci-fi action story with a Cool Willis leading it all even if he's not exactly giving it his all, still miles better than the usual Steven Seagal DTV flick. Small minimalist budget yes but i see alot of creativity went into creating the look & it's futuristic technology & it does look Good for it's budget!!!

At times i got the feel & vibe of a POWER RANGERS episode or movie, especially when they gear up with body armour suits & when they fight the Alien beings (that seem like possessed humans as you Don't ever see their faces or what they really are) the villains come accross as the type that the Power Rangers would battle but hey it's a Low-budget slice of Sci-fi Thriller cheese so i just took it for that. Our team are power boosted through space & land on another planet that is fine for Humans & the rest of the Cheese fest plays on the forest planet with rebels (like STAR WARS) & the action is fine for a cheap flick with laser guns & possessed warriors that also reminded of John Carpenter's Ghost's of Mars just like ANTI-LIFE did too!!!! Many Sci-fi flicks enfluenced this as did ANTI-LIFE & like i said both written by Edward Drake but only this one was directed by him.

Cosmic Sin just like Anti-life is a cheap, trashy & cheesy but fun B-movie that's nothing special or great but an easy watch & does make a nice Double bill with ANTI-LIFE. Entertaining & fun.

My guess is that the little girl popping out of nowhere is actually the illegitimate child Bruce had with the Queen of the aliens, which he meets in a cave, where they both get high. Refusing to pay alimony he decides to nuke 'em all for good measure, in typical BW fashion.

I hope there will be a prequel.

review_title: The cosmic sin is if you watch this movie
review_detailed_main:
This movie is so bad, it is actually the worst movie I have watched recently and if there were no B. Willis, I would not have even thought of watching it. I could not belive Mr. Willis would be a part of such high school production. If I could give it a zero points I would. It is so predictable, boring, with useless action and fights. Never make another movie like that please.

The story has potential, special effects are subpar, you can see the suits they are wearing are made of flimsy plastic, the weapons in 25th century are guns with bullets, they use old keyboards and computers that emite weird songs, people drive on the highway in regular pick up trucks and motor bikes that are made in the 21st century and are well over 400 year old. The highlight of the sci-fi is a jubox from the 1960...Really what were they thinking. Start trek from the late 60 had better effects and better equipment than characters in this movie. I really do not know where were the people with imagination when they were writing the script? It is beyond bad. If you want to do yourself a good thing, go for a walk in the rain, go for a run, call your friends or go get your groceries, take out the garbage, vacuume the apartment. Those 88 minutes will be much better spent than by watching this "masterpiece". The cosmic sin is if you watch this movie.

review_title: I can only assume this is some kind of tax write off
review_detailed_main: It's not even a nonsense plot. It's no plot at all. Terrible acting. Abysmal script. Special effects that look like they were done for a 1990s computer game. Sound mix all over the place so you can't hear half the dialogue (which is a blessing in this case). Music composed by someone who was watching a different movie. Costumes leftover from a Buzz Lightyear cosplay convention. Locations scouted from a 1980s episode of Doctor Who. I bet even the on set catering was dreadful. The only good thing about this movie is that it's fairly short.

review_title: Don't believe the hate - Good Scifi movie

Maybe people expect something original in 2021? Or compare to Bruces older movies. Whatever grab the popcorn and enjoy!!

Really i found this movie made my Friday night - And makes you think what if we're not alone and not friendly?

review_title: The only sin here was making this movie!

review_title: So awful I couldn't even finish it
review_detailed_main: I am a Sci-Fi buff, and this listed Bruce Willis in the credits. And I thought well there you have it sci-fi and Bruce Willis it's got to be at least watchable. I have to admit that I stopped watching the film 15 minutes before it was over. It was so bad, so poorly acted and poorly written, that I just couldn't punish myself anymore. Even for past lives the punishment is too severe to watch this movie. I recommend that everyone read the other reviews about how poorly done this movie is. They state it far more clearly than I. To say I was disappointed it's an understatement. It was horrific and like a train wreck or a car accident that you can't turn away from to see Bruce Willis in this. He looks like a deer caught in headlights, his eyes are shiny and there is no one home. It is heartbreaking that he has been used the last few films he was forced to do I'm sure. I feel badly for him being burdened with this drivel. Bruce Willis and certainly the. Audience deserve better. Avoid this movie and save yourself some heartbreak and torment.

There were so many people involved.

How any of them did not ask: "This does not make any sense?"

(Had to register an account on IMDB to warn you.)

That says it all. So bad it's like watching a train wreck. Can't stop watching it. LOL.
I really don't know what I just watched. So awful total garbage..couldn't finish watching it past 15 minutes of this crap. I will watch Sharknado over this garbage any day.

Brandon Thomas Lee should never work as an actor again. Don't care who his parents are, dude is terrible. I am the guy that is known for watching any movie, no matter how bad it is. Frank and Bruce had to habe been coerced into making this. Their kids were being held hostage or something.
What a waste of time to produce something like this or watch it... nuff said.

review_title: One of the best movies ever made
review_detailed_main: Please don't disrespect it by giving it a 1/10. It's close to -5 in story, editing, acting, but it's a 11 at heart. This is not a bad movie, per say. It's a masterpiece in how awful it is in every department. I don't know a studio can get such a cast, such a CGI crew and fail monumentally in making the film. The acting looks like a workshop rehearsal, although all the CG is top-notch stuff. Watch it if you had a bad day in office, had an argument with spouse, or if your favourite team lost in a sport to your least favourite team. This movie washes away all sorrow in how bad it is. A true idol of this generation. You'll find yourself asking if it's worth being showcased in a museum or give diarrhea to a swamp full of alligators. No one knows for sure. One thing is for certain: it's one of those generational movies that you'll take to your grave.

This film is.not quite an A, more like a B+, and worth aty least one watch. Nothing about this scifi is "bad", it is just never GREAT.

Bruce looks tired and bored, but perhaps that is his character. Within the first 20 minutes of the movie, I had him pegged as some kind of highly functional sociopath, then he seems just sad.

Effects are just decent, acting is acceptable, storyline has empty spaces in it, the science is almost believable (most scifi's science is stupid), but it is worth a watch.

review_title: I am an hour in and I hopped on here because I can't believe this is real

review_title: Definitely a sin of cosmic proportions
review_detailed_main:
There's already plenty of reviews to let you know this is the greatest disaster mankind has faced on this world. This is Covid, Ragnarok, and the Sun going supernova all rolled into an aluminum foil-wrapped hot pocket in a microwave. How this ever made it from script to production is a question to which the answer, if there even is one, I can assume is safely tucked inside Pandora's Box, never to be known lest it lead to more abominations like this being made on the regular.

Completely bland and boring, from the dialogue to the set pieces. Scenes just come and go, offering no substance other than merely padding the time. Anyone giving this high marks because it's "hilariously bad" is doing a disservice by inflating the overall score (currently 2.5).

The only thing that could be considered slightly decent quality is some of the special effects work, which is still outclassed by most tv commercials. Everything else will leave you wishing you could go back in time and stop Bruce from destroying that asteroid so the world wouldn't have to suffer this.
Thoroughly enjoyed it. Always love me some Bruce Willis. Legend.

review_title: Why do we think everything has a message

If it wasanyone but Willis, it would have a higher score but the prejudice here is obvious. Is it a good movie? No it isn't, but it is not that bad. I think it will do better on Netflix than anywhere else and I like Willis. Critics will take the opportunity to slam him and the movie, but critics mean very little to action movie watchers.

A First Contact containment facility that is worse than the capitol building security during 6th Jan 2021. The first 20 minutes make it unbearable for even a person bored to death in a pandemic lockdown to watch.
Terrible. Awful Awful dialogue. I've heard grotty old man farts that sounded better then most lines this movie vomited out. I will always love Brucey, but Cmon, are his bills that bad?

PLOT: The plot was as hastily shown as it was written. No depth, no message, just a sloppily pieced together non-story. 100% predictable. Mediocre. As if the director was just rushing to tell and go home to sleep it off. No effort to make a compelling story.

PROPS: Power-ranger class "villains" with some sort of rubber-plastic "armor" that looks 100% pointless and silly. Ive seen better costumes in that D&D movie with the purple moron evil magician. The planetary defense cannon looked like a 60s carnival ride.

DIRECTION: The director lacks a basic understanding of how physics works in space or low-gravity. Heck, he doesn't even grasp earth gravity.

PLOTHOLES: Beyond count...

It´s horrible to see how Bruce was used as a commodity. Everyone involved in this movie must have noticed hos bad Bruce was doing. I had to watch this one. We have all known for the past year how ill Bruce Willis was in the last movies... And even if this one is from the early stages of the illness, you can see that he is not the same, and that off course affects the whole movie. One expects a story that evolves around Willis, but the whole script is adapted and twisted... So the story flies all over the place, and the insane mish-mash of present and far away future features is not doing it any favours. As a movie, I guess its good for a hang-over morning... Press play, and fall asleep once in a while, and watch with half an eye. Thats how much you should invest in this one, because they clearly did not invest enough to make this script coherent and manageable...

Bruce Willis career, and him as a person, deserved a better destiny than this... To be used as a commodity and forced into to movies, where he wore an earpiece just to be able to deliver the lines. The people around him saw him as a cash-cow and used him without regret. I wont remember Willis for this, but I will remember him for the Die Hard´s and The sixth sence.

review_title: 90 minutes of my life I'll never get back.

A plot thinner than paper, a script that a kindergartner could have came up with and acting that is on the very bottom of the scale. At least the effects looked nice.

Why was this made, I have no idea what was going on the entire movie. I tried to like it but holy hell this movie came with a shovel. Every time I thought something couldn't get worse, this movie somehow kept getting under a bar that I thought couldn't get lower.

There is nothing to gain from watching this... "Movie" aside from intense feelings of disappointment and maybe a little anger.

It deeply made me want to replay StarCraft 2.

Bruce Willis NAIIIIIILS his Jim Raynor impression.

What I most enjoyed is the fact that story has nothing new to offer. That way, I don't have to use my brain to watch the movie. That saved me a lot of headaches, trying to figure stuff out, and keep track of any kind of story.

review_title: Save your time watch something else.

Some B and C grade actors have been thrown in the mix, I guess the movie makers decided to throw a few unknowns in because they had to fork out a fortune to get Willis and Grillo- but the acting talent definitely ends with the big guys, and so did the budget. This claptrap recycles old Independence Day troupes and doesn't even do a good job of it. Bruce Willis is the same character he plays in every movie- world weary, hard-done-by, ex expert at everything you can name, reluctantly dragged into a catastrophe so he can rescue everyone. You've seen it all before a thousand times.

Remember the 2000 frames of film Bruce Willis appeared in in the planet terror segment of grind house? Better to watch that 125 feet of film over & over... & over, than to let precious seconds of your life slip away one heartbeat and eyeblink at a time watching this dumpster fire on a train wreck.

I keep telling myself this isn't actually Bruce Willis, this is early prototype deep fake tech. Or somebody near and dear to Bruce was kidnapped and held in a cage over a pool of sharks with a candle burning through the rope to force him to participate.

I can't imagine anybody watching this on purpose twice.
All you boomers hating on Bruce Willis for enjoying what he does need to get over it. The movie was actually really good.

I was focused the whole movie & enjoy hyperthetical scenarios that could develop in our earth's future.

Sounds grim though for our future generations, but who knows what's coming.

I noticed a few problems within the development of certain parts of this production....and now I guess I know why.

Sorry Mr Willis, I always enjoy your presence in everything you make....but Cosmic Sin's higher point would have to go to Perrey Reeve's character & her incredible voice transformation.

The musical score by Scott is also amazing!

Good luck & hugs Bruce....x.

Weird flex.

Wow, the movie is so stupid, that it does not warrant longer review.

The only good thing about this movie is that lots of people would have been paid to make it, and the wealthy studio execs who made it lost money. Godawful.

review_title: Why wasn't this a big budget movie?
review_detailed_main:
I feel like 2 stars is generous because this movie is really bad. Low quality on every level. But I'm a self-proclaimed sci-fi junkie and I enjoyed all of the sci-fi elements and concepts. Everything else is laughable.

This is the kind of premise that will always get me to watch a movie. I just don't understand why it didn't attract a studio that could have turned this into a big budget blockbuster. In the right hands it could have been an awesome sci-fi action flick, something along the lines of Edge of Tomorrow. But instead we get this direct-to-video garbage. (1 viewing, 1/21/2022)

It feels like some low budget fan film that is so bad the other fan films don't want anything to do with it.

Plot sucks, directing sucks, writing really really sucks, acting really really really sucks.

Why Bruce Willis would want to be involved in this pile of poop is beyond me. I'm guessing he lost a bet or was heavily medicated at the time and had no clue what all the cameras around him were for.
Bruce Willis is on point! i hope he got payed a bundle for this one because he is worth every penny! didn't phone this one in at all! amazing complex story with believable and well rounded characters

review_title: Expect improved ratings in the years to come...
review_detailed_main:
When it comes to this genre (Sci-Fi / Action / Alien Invasion) of movies, the film industry has been spewing out cookie-cutter, worn out garbage for nearly two decades, feeding us one lame cookie-cutter superhero remake after another after another.

Those of us who love this genre of movies have been begging for new movies that surprise us and capture our attention. We want movies that require real thought to understand and use our imagination. The issue is that many people had very high expectations for this movie, due to the casting of Bruce Willis as the main character.

In contrast, if the movie was cast of main characters that are not well known, people would have no real expectations for a top shelf movie, and would be impressed by the visuals and originality, and would have a rating in the 5.5 to 6.5 range.

That being said, here we have a movie that gives us what we have been asking for... but how did we respond? With hyper-critical disdain and complaints, and worst of all, a 2.5 rating. Come on now people.. Don't be so hard on this movie. Also, Willis has been in serious mental decline since this movie was made, and he is now in a serious condition, and he is nearing the end of his life.

Cheers to Bruce Willis for all the amazing work he has done over the years. What a legend.
This is absolute garbage. There really is no need for more review. It's a film, there really are no redeeming qualities. Just garbage.
Everything. I mean EVERYTHING was bad. The effects were garbage, costumes were cheap, so many "wtf is going on" moments. Script was bad. This movie should not have been made.

I've got a pretty high tolerance for schlock(I've seen all 7 Tremors movies, AND the Show. I'm a huge Resident Evil Film Franchise fan. I could go on.) and honestly even I had a hard time getting through this one. I expected Bruce Willis to be sleepwalking his way through, like most films he's done in the last decade, but I didn't expect Frank Grillo to be pulling the same stunt.

The younger less known set of actors try to put some flavor into it and the script seems to be trying for some sort of "is war just" point, but the nebulously defined zombie/fantasy/scifi aliens make any ''''''deep''''' quotes feel haphazard and pretentious.

The sets are basic, all of the action taking place on either A) a greenscreen, B) cement bunker or C) A rough greenscreen trying to approximate space. In still images, the sort of armor suits the characters wear look cool, however any time an actor moves, it's clear they're just plastic shells hastily velcro'd onto the actor in some sort of wetsuit.

All that would be entirely excusable if the actual plot, or characters, or world was engaging. It's not. It feels like a lesser Halo plot only with less nuance, less character, and unfortunately a very "Kill them all" attitude.

Skip it.

This movie isn't for everyone, clearly. A bit of a shame really, as it's a classic sci-fi adventure that revolves around exploring an interesting premise.

This movie, if turned into a short-fiction novel, would make for a fun Sunday read, even if a bit geeky in nature.

Where this movie loses some critics is that it is a low-budget film, with a big-name actor being the only surface-level attraction. If you accept it as a made-for-TV movie rather than a blockbuster, you may be more easily look past its limitations.

The premise of the movie is how should terrains, spacefaring humans, react to first contact with a suspected aggressive alien race. Some movies with such a premise play out the notion of humans being being dominated by the aliens and enslaved, which is what critics love to see. This movie takes an aggressive opposing stance, even more so than Ender's Game, and argues for swift action over weakness.

"I was late once and so he broke my nose. I was never late again."

Geeky Easter eggs exist in the movie, such as the space battleships you see appear to be StarCraft Terran Battlecruisers. It helps to explain the universe without needing to say much at all; something critics would miss.

Like most of Bruce Willis movies these days, they run counter to modern liberal norms. I'm giving this movie a 7/10, as there were some cheesy fight scenes and some of the props looked a bit silly. The story was a bit abrupt at times, which might cause issues for viewers that need things spelled out for them, but I didn't have that issue myself.

Overall, I enjoyed watching it.

Seriously! Terrible screenplay, unrealistic, stilted script, terrible direction... I could go on but its trust me, the whole thing is just appalling.

The good. Well, the actual performances from Willis, Grillo are pretty good. They've not phoned in their exploits here, but put some effort into good performances. However, in the grand scheme of things it makes little difference. Aside from the aforementioned, Lee, and maybe a couple others, the rest of the cast is really below par and suitably in line with the rest of the already poor production.

The only thing this film needs is Nick Cage in his current professional guise to finish it off.

I assure you, 2/10 is a very fair score.

review_title: A terrible movie... Bruce should fire his agent
review_detailed_main:
From the first 30seconds of the movie, I already knew this movie was going to be trash, but I didn't realize just HOW trash it was going to be. This is a 3rd-rate movie that hitched their ENTIRE wagon onto Bruce Willis' name... without him nobody would even have bothered streaming this movie, nevermind watching it at the theatres.

This movie HAS TO have had a budget below $15mil..... it would be an absolute travesty if they spent anything more than that on this terrible movie. And I'm sorry but if you're going to attempt to make a 'sci-fi space epic adventure film' on a budget of $15mil or less then you're just insane. 1 or 2mil probably went to Bruce and that left the rest of the movie with an already shoe-string budget. The CGI is bad. The editing is bad. The majority of the movie takes place in darkness, so they didn't have to spend money on set-pieces. There's an INSANE amount of vignetting, lens flare and vaseline-lens going on as well, which is a huge indicator of a terrible production. Easily 30% of the movie is show with vaseline on the lens, I'm certain of it.

There's SO MANY things that this movie COULD have done differently to make it seem like it had a bigger budget. Upgrade (2018) is a FANTASTIC example of how to make a sci-fi film with NO budget. I mean Upgrade (2018) had a $3mil budget which is absolutely insane, and if you watched that movie then you'd know that it certainly didn't seem like a shoe-string budgeted movie. Really the fault comes down on the bad director of this movie and just the whole production team as well (since the editing and framing of this movie is terrible too).

This movie has no real redeemable qualities and I'd HIGHLY recommend that you watch something else instead. This movie is literally a waste of time and the only one who probably benefitted from this experience is Bruce Willis since he can walk away with a cool couple million (although I respect him less as an actor because of this movie now).

Not sure what leverage someone had on Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo, but the debt paid isn't worth it at all because this film should not be released and be buried by anyone associated with it. Cheap costumes and sets, hammy dialogue, poor and horrible support cast coupled with a story that is so painfully written and edited that even the z-grade effects and stunts can't save it as being one of those guilty pleasure bad movies. Avoid like the plague or at best watch it during Covid lockdown when you've exhausted all other media options. I'm genuinely hoping this was made purely to get some tax credit in Georgia because it is the worst I've seen for some time.

The power-armor suits were bad, the enemies are just makeup zombies, and the story isn't much, but Cosmic Sin doesn't deserve 2.5/10 - i've seen stuff MUCH worse than this with a far higher rating. And, no midichlorians.
