The ONLY positive that I can write about this movie is that the visual effects were OK. They were not bad, they were not good, but at least they were OK.

The sound quality was OK, but music/sounds were at times badly chosen. For example, the sound on top of a fight scene towards the end was a harmonica playing...

The acting was between OK and bad. The most of the time it was bad. The manuscript and the directing was mostly really bad! Several scenes were more or less over after a few seconds without any build up before, or any follow up afterwards. Leaving the viewer with no explanation to neither why or how things happened!! Several scenes and lines during the movie was just cringeworthy!

Do not make the same mistakes that I did: This movie IS as bad as the rating of 2.5 indicates that it is, and it is NOT worth the time watching it!

review_title: Sad Film 2 End With: Ho Hum
review_detailed_main:
Will miss Bruce as he faces a terrible disease. Seriously great actor.

The movie is truly weak but, some moments r great. Mostly disjointed, lacking ANY interest. Why bother.

It is bad. It is really, really bad. I wonder, none of the production team could even bother saying a word of reason? It is so bad that 500 years in the future and all the context looks and sounds like some sort of 1990 idea. My gosh, what an awful movie! Even the aliens fight with axes and swords. Please, don't even waste your time.

For movies like this you should be allowed to give a negative score. The only use this movie had was that the production of it paid some peoples wages. Bruce Willis whats happening? Anti-life and now this. Elon Musk do us all a favour and put Bruce on the next test flight if he wants to be in space this much.

review_title: Bruce, you owe me 90 minutes of my life back
review_detailed_main:
Future? So we still have concrete block buildings, manual doors, dirty windows, pallets, crates, motorcycles, bad make-up, and . . what the heck, why should I take more time to review this.

Do not watch it. Go observe the growth of a cactus and you will use your time better.
I gave it a one because it would not let me give a zero. Bruce Willis must really need the money.

review_title: I have to delete my brain now
review_detailed_main: I have to erase this movie from my mind. I have to find some intergalactic cosmic gin. They should warn you to do that before you watch just five minutes of this psychological horror on film. Did Bruce Willis make a pact with the devil and now he has to pay the price by decimating his career? Or why does he hate himself so much?

Sorry no spoilers, the cast and crew were responsible for that.

The year is 2524. We have cars. As in infernal combustion engine driven cars. We have guns. And...

We still have Bruce. This guy just doesn't know when to quit. What? Another part shot in a day?

This all just results in someone asking, Really...?

Bruce! Retire.......!

What the heck bruce? You would expect a movie with your face on the cover to be above average, aven if it's a cliché, but now it's BAD in every possible way: screenplay, camera is all over the place, acting is horrendous, .. looks like a low budget tv film. What an absolute shame..

review_title: Woah, I really didn't expect a Bruce Willis film to be this portly done
review_detailed_main:
Geez, I'm really surprised how poorly executed this film was. Bruce Willis usually does much better stuff. Some cool big budget CGI though, but doesn't make up for poor scripting, goofs and continuity fails in the first 30 minutes (before I gave up). I love dodgy b-grade sci-fi (even low scoring ones) usually, but this is too bad.

I think the kicker for me was being hundreds of years in the future but the roads being filled with petrol cars and trucks from the 90s. I mean really, someone driving a 300 year old petrol pick-up truck as a daily drive. Nope. It would be in a museum.

I could go on, but no need. I wish I had bothered to look at these IMDb reviews before losing 30 minutes of my life. Lesson learned. Trust IMDb users scores people!

Did anyone else have trouble finding any sense

how was this authorized lol.

review_title: Wow, I struggled to watch this
review_detailed_main:
I made it 34 mins before my gag reflex kicked in. It's only an 88min movie and I couldn't find the energy to last.

Everything that the other reviews say is true. Gas cars, 2010-era motorcycles, bullet-firing guns. Etc, etc. The simple fact that humans would still be around in 500 years was laughable at this point.

I started to channel Wesley Snipes: "Where's all the phasers and s%^&?" No one has cybernetics, bionic limbs, or nanomachines built into them?

Seriously bad movie. Bruce Willis seems to be on a bad roll lately, with Breach and this disaster.

review_title: Absolutely abhorrent sin against the movie industry
review_detailed_main:
Word has it that aliens saw this movie and blacklisted our planet for another 40000 years. This is not even a movie, this is more of a group of kid's backyard movie project. The only thing i cannot figure it why is willis in it. There is no way this had the budget to pay him, so i suspect it was a case of a kid asking him to stand in front of their camcorder and ponder upon his resume why he is doing this.

Acting is terrible, script is terrible, plot is copy paste, design elements are not even questionable, but downright hilarious. The aliens are apparently wraiths from lord of the rings franchise. Brilliant!

This is not bad in an entertaining way. This is bad in a bad way. You will have absolutely no value from watching this.

review_title: You Go In Thinking: There Has To Be Something Worthwhile In Here...
review_detailed_main: There isn't... One of the worst movies I've ever seen... And I like Sci-Fi, Bruce Willis, and even Frank Grillo... I kept waiting for it to be some sort of self aware joke... But no... Horrible directing, horrible dialogue, cliche upon cliche... Just don't!!!
Mindless plot with woeful acting, hoping to redeem itself with some big screen names. The clothing, American V8 utes, and weapons from the 20th century in the 26th century?

I haven't written a movie review on here in years, but really needed to for this one. I saw the trailer, read the reviews and thought "nah, no way Bruce Willis would go down in a fiery crash with his acting career doing below F grade movies." Well, I was wrong. So VERY wrong. The reviews here are point on. I wish I could give this a movie a zero. It was the worst crap I've seen all year.

I don't know if Bruce owes someone money or everyone in this film is hurting for cash because of COVID. It sucked BADLY. Seriously save your time and skip this one. It had everything bad that you could think of in a movie.

The plot was weak and missing any details that would've made this movie somewhat interesting. The actors looked like they didn't care to be there, especially Bruce who seemed drunk or stoned most of the time. Also, the actions of the characters made absolutely no sense "put your hands up" to people that are decaying and zombie-looking. What the hell?!

The editing was nauseating at best. The dialogs, oh god the dialogs were long and boring. Yak yak yak with pointless fillers that only extended the torture of trying to watch this.

The CGI was mediocre at best. My pre-teen daughter plays with Blender and can do a WAY better job that what they did in this movie for CGI effects. The props were also pretty bad. Someone on here stated their suit of armour looked like plastic. No, it wasn't plastic, more like spray-painted foam with two colored LEDs mounted on each side of their heads. I have a 3D printer and I can make way better props than the ones used in this film. The music kept repeating the same annoying rhythms and drowning out the dialogs at times (may be I should be thankful for that).

I found myself fast forwarding a lot through this movie HOPING for something good, for ANYTHING to redeem this crap that was wasting my precious time, but I was sorely disappointed. I can go on and on about how bad this was but I feel I've ranted enough. Please trust the reviews here, they are right. If not just trust me and avoid this one like the plague.

review_title: The worst film I ever watched
review_detailed_main: Seriously? Don't waist your time. The actors are so bad, even Bruce. (What is he doing?). The photography instead of showing a high tech civilization of 2500 show a normal city with some flying cars in the background, really? Nothing in this movie looks futuristic.

review_title: Seeing that it is a movie advocating for war crimes
review_detailed_main: I guess the fact that it managed to get EVERYTHING wrong was not such a bad thing after all.

This movie. This movie is less than 1 star. Disjointed. Unwatchable. Stupid. Appalling.

Just some of the words which apply to this mess.

I still don't follow some of the "storyline" and I use that term loosely. But I'm not prepared to watch it again to try to understand it.

review_title: I want to put 0 star but I can't
review_detailed_main: It's literally a Z movie with some money, everything from the CGI to the dialog is horrible, for a minute I have think this was a 2001 film, horrible anyway.

So, in 500 years, we'll all still be driving petrol/diesel vehicles that look a lot like models seen on the road today. Despite fossil fuels being phased out now...

Guns - well, a lot like those we have now, and seems somewhat unlikely the technology.of weaponry hasn't improved somewhat in 500 years.

Incandescent light bulbs that are pretty much already phased out, and neon galore.

Within a few minutes it fails to suspend your disbelief, but I persevered and watched another 20 minutes before I raised the acting, the script, and the entire premise doesn't offer any reprieve from the pit of crap you already found yourself in.

And come on, Bruce Willis playing an action role? Still? Because when you run into an aggressive alien species, we're going to need a geriatric has been to save us all...

I watch a lot of sci-fi, and I'm prepared to forgive a low budget production if the idea, the story, and/or the script have some merit. But there's nothing at all here to commend it. Nothing.

With the money you spent and the cast you had, it requires special talent to come up with such a scrap. The director and the script writer should share all the credits. Just cant believe what I saw. I thought of giving up midway but then continued just to find out how worse it could be. I have seen plays in school more organized than this. I will recommend everyone to watch this movie and promise no other movie will disappoint you then.

Thank god this was free with my Netflix subscription... while I understand early on during the pandemic corners and budgets may have had to been cut to provide a safe work environment but really? I can only hope that this will be the last release effected by those circumstances because any other excuse would be nonsense. The bad acting, poor set design, Xbox 360 worthy special effects, shoddy storyline, and otherwise poor example of a sci-fi thriller casting both Frank Grillo and Bruce Willis make Plan 9 from Outer Space look like James Cameron's Avatar. 1 star for Mr. Grillo, 1 star for Mr. Willis, and 1 star for the effort made by the production team rounds out this more than forgiving 3 star review.

Embarrassing on every level.

Ground scenes shot in some boring leafless backlot forest, while using hand weaponry that looks like something you can buy at Walmart next week, not hundreds of years in the future.

This Tel-Aviv/Hong Kong Saban Films fiasco - more a real estate, Asian film distribution and investment firm than anything else - is 100% cringe-worthy.

As for Corey Large - normally it appears he's a producer of sorts - and his "writing" of this thing, at least he had the junk to also "act" in it so convinced was he that it was good on some level. He knows better now.

Wrap all this up with the clause Willis seemingly has in his acting contract that he won't go over 100 words of dialogue in a movie.

(Nice to get millions for an amount of words you could easily write on your forearm.)

Oddly enough even thespian talents like Wayne Gretzky and Tommy Lees' sons aren't sufficient to save this bowl of curdled cinematic yogurt. Go figure.

Apparently Netflix is more than happy to throw in absolutely anything to feed it's huge streaming content grinder.
Script, acting, everything was just bad. Not even Bruce Willis could make it better. He must have owed someone money or a huge favor.
I've never saw a movie wear its name so well Cause yes, indeed, making this movie was a huge « insert title » Seems Bruce Willis is gonna be all nostalgia for us now.

review_title: A Cosmic Dud featuring a miserable Bruce Willis.
review_detailed_main:
This might be the worst film of 2021....

A non-sensical story, non-existent characters, cheap visual effects, lazy sound editing, inconsistent production designs, badly edited action scenes and a miserable, half-dead Bruce Willis sleepwalking into another pile of cinematic dirt with even less dignity and charisma than Steven Seagal.

The plot involved something about space colonization and an army fleet of alien parasites from a distant planet that could wipe out humanity (how original), and Bruce Willis plays a retired general who's called back to help stop this threat (how exciting). I barely remember anything else about the plot but it doubt any of it was important. It was so lazily written that it might as well have been auto-generated by an Xbox 360.

I don't know what anyone was doing or even thinking while they were making this lousy attempt of a film. Every single component of the film just seems so lazy and uninspired that its likely everyone involved was half asleep during the production process. From a technical standpoint its almost as bad as Snyder's Army of the Dead (I honestly don't understand the appeal). The film looks ugly in parts. Like AotD a lot of the background is out of focus, but here it appears to be an attempt to block the cheap production designs. The visual effects had the quality of a 10 year old episode of Doctor Who, and the sound editing was flat and lifeless. This is bad even by DTV standards.

As for Bruce, what the heck has happened to him?! He looked tired and worn out, like a retired has-been who's desperate for money. There's one line of dialogue that summarizes Bruce's current state. When he puts on an exosuit and one of the characters say that it "belongs in a museum", he quips: "They said the same thing about me." And he's not wrong.

Just stay retired Bruce, nobody wants to waste 90 minutes of their time for useless fodder like this.
I can't describe how bad this movie is. I mean you won't feel sadness during emotional scene and it is also hard to tell who is true and who isn't.

I wish I could enjoy how bad it was but it's just too frustrating. I can't remember the last time I turned a movie off without finishing it.

The year is supposed to be 2524.. Everyone drives 90's cars, the guns are normal, cellphones, clothes.. The "Q-Bomb" (worlds most powerful weapon) is a piece of glass with a standard Phillips screw inside. I'm not kidding.

Every prop, set, costume is incredibly unbelievable and everything looks cheap. It's so so bad.

The script is atrocious, every scene is painful to watch.

I don't know if Bruce Willis could ever really act, he is not acting in this film.. The story is offensive.

The first encounter the ailens look unworldy and then they are just regular humans with a head twitch.

Nine of them, unarmed and walking like zombies take over a military base, the cast then travel 13 lightyears away through space flying only wearing some plastic on their torsos.

Again, this is not "so bad it's good" it's just bad, it's time you will never get back, time that is better spent elsewhere.

The Worst piece of sh..it i ever seen. Bruce Willis is so tired in tjos role its Almis funny,the Actors are the sadest bunch i ever seen,the script is a joke. This can be the Turkey of the year. And yes im a sci-fi fan...

I would rate it lower if I could. The story seems to be one rejected from the worse of adult films. Absolutely confused and disjointed.

I couldn't actually supply a spoiler because that would assume there was a plot to spoil.

review_title: Was this written by a 10 year old?
review_detailed_main: Seriously wanted to like this, I like Bruce Willis,I like sci-fi, even b-grade stuff ....but this literally feels like someone tried to make a movie from a ten year old's poorly written homemade comic book. Everything is just cobbled together pieces of dead horses that were beaten apart years ago and half the dialogue and concepts seem outright random and senseless. Also they should have called this "Tachyon Interference" since it's said so many times; apparently that was the only science term the writers knew?

review_title: Only watched it cos Bruce Willis was in it
review_detailed_main: A jumbled mess of a film. Worst sci-fi film I've ever seen.

review_title: Just bad! Really bad and gets worse!

review_detailed_main: I have been watching this movie for alomst a week now. I watch a lil part everyday from how much awful it is. I can just simply pass it, but I am trying to find anything good about it. It is terrible. This is really a cosmic sin, it is a sin to do something this awful. Bruce, stay away from such cheap movies. I am considering that you were not in that movie. That girl specially, Adelaide Kane... What on Earth are you?! Girl you cannot act at all I give you a big Zero and I give the movie -10!!!
Getting a little short of cash, Bruce? Cosmic Turkey... BREACH gobbles just as badly. I sincerely hope this wasn't part of a three picture deal. Please,,,, No More..

review_title: Soon Bruce Willis will make Movies with Steven Seagal
review_detailed_main:
Yup, here I said it. Bruce Willis' career or what remains of it is faster and faster circling down the drain to Steven Seagal bad movie levels.

What the hell happenend Bruce? It's pretty obvious now that he is not even pretending to care anymore.

Is that man so desperate for a paychek that he even outdoes Steven Seagal and Nicolas Cage in terms of bad One Dollar Bin flicks?

Jesus Christ Bruce, what the hell happened?
Truly and I mean truly do not waste any money on this dribble.
If someone asks you to watch this movie, tell them you're busy cleaning your fridge magnets. The 'Director' should also be charged with some form of terrorism. Truly.

review_title: So bad it's good, except it's not
review_detailed_main:
This stinker is going to walk The Razzies.

It looks as if all the worst Sci-fi films ever were cut into 10sec lengths, mixed in a tumble dryer and randomly stuck together.

Incomprehensible plot, costumes rented from the local fancy dress, acting as wooden as the forest that much of it has been filmed in, Bruce sleepwalks through this nightmare on Mogadon.

Surely he does not need the money this bad and even if he does he could do something less humiliating, TV Adverts for feminine hygiene products or pills to help mens' bedroom difficulties perhaps.

It gets two stars because ,mercifully, it's only 88 minutes long.

Bruce Willis rose from his slumber just for this terrible film? Which he appears to be in throughout this terrible sci-fi blunder. The fil is set into the future but people still uses technology from 1990's what a terrible sci0fi movie.

I will never get back 90 minutes of my life.

The base idea could have worked, but.. nah it is bad.

Simply terrible.

No story, no sense, nothing.

I lost 1h my life.

I want it back.
It's been a while since I saw a film so bad. Terrible acting all around. Even the cliches are rubbish. Plot is utter nonsense. Poor music. Avoid at all costs.

review_title: Cosmic Sin Vs Breach. Why the same movie?

review_detailed_main:
The graphics are beautiful but the storyline and conversations of 'Cosmic Sin' are unfitting and out of line, to a point where you're wondering why a specific line is said or a scene is shown because it just does not make any sense. Without Grillo and Willis the whole movie would've been even weaker.

Why they did it this way? Unknown. All I can think of as an explanation is that someone knew someone or that one of the (B-)actors or others involved in this movie had an idea or a wish and they hastily started filming instead of properly writing a good story with the result being a total waste while there was so much potential. I cannot rate lower than a 1 here on IMDB.

If someone can seriously explain to me what was it about, why was there Bruce Willis and how it ended I will raise my rating to 2 stars ... From the first 5 minutes I knew it will be super crap but it was even worse.
A precious hour of my life as been successful wasted watching this video.

review_title: Bruce Willis truly has committed a Cosmic Sin starring in this rubbish
review_detailed_main:
Bruce Willis hasn't really made a good movie in years and has continued that trend with this rubbish, I guess old habits Die Hard, If only he had a Sixth Sense when it came to movie scripts, I can only think he has signed up to make as many bad movies as possible and breaking that trend would be a Breach of contract, and the studio has him held Hostage, when it comes to his career he seems to have a Death Wish.

He doesn't even try to put in a good effort into a movie anymore and every performance is a Cop-Out.

He has committed career Armageddon starring in this rubbish that is for sure.

review_title: Bad in most ways with a few good ideas but not enough...

review_detailed_main:
I want back 88 minuters of my Life...wait I fel asleep twice for about 10 min.

Is this film just some tax evasion scam ??

Are you jobless? Have you been rejected at the school.performance when you were a teenager? Did you ever dream to be a writer but your were constantly failing at school in literature?

Don't worry you still have a chance! If they did this film and were able to place it, you can do as well.

Probably the producer said "Alexa write me a script for a science fiction movie"

I put 3 stars just because the idea of the space travel with the."Robo vest" was funny.

review_title: Cinema threw up and this was the carrot
review_detailed_main: Truly awful and definately trying to rip off the HALO franchise.
I cant believe mr. Willis has accepted to be in this movie and congrats to the editor😂

WTF! You can F'n see what they look like and you still bring them back to our planet?

I'm going to stop watching now 20 minutes in. ARrrrgggghhh.

I was really hoping it would be good with Bruce Willis in it.

review_title: I hope Bruce got paid in cash for this mess...
review_detailed_main:
Wow! What a piece of anachronistic garbage! 500 years in the future and they still drive 2019 Toyota pickup trucks and use conventional guns. Not to mention the Harley. Plot was pointless, dialog horrendous, acting was wretched. Nothing fun or redeeming about this movie. Absolute of time.

It amazes me to think someone actually green-lit this garbage!

I thought the worst movie ever would be Green Lantern. I was wrong. This is now the worst movie ever. What could possibly make people sign up for a script like this, with such horrible lines. The acting is completely forced, camera angles, nothing makes any sense in this movie.

As someone who loves Sci-Fi movies, i cant get over this one... bad acting, bad writing. Why would you came up with such an idea, and even if i could live with that idea, why would you convert that idea like that in a movie.

Save your time and watch your wall, which might have a better story telling quality.

Whoever directed this, and shot this, should be shot. the nausea-inducing photography is just the tip of this pile of space trash. Bruce must have been an absolute pleasure to work with here, he doesn't seem annoyed AT ALL. wanna actually GREAT brand new SCI-FI movie?? try space sweepers! p.s. 400 years in the future aaaaaaaand... a 2016 motorcycle, makes sense. honestly looks like a fan made movie that somehow blackmailed BW into starring, it's 2021.... how does this trash still get made?! looks like there was a sale on blue/pink/red stage lights 😂
The playbill of the movie is more paced than the movie itself.

You see, if most of us screwed up this bad doing what we do to get paid, we'd be out of a job. But the jokers who somehow conned their way in to funding this project and hiring the worst teams of writers, producers, editors and actors (with a couple exceptions) will be allowed to continue working in show business. After that ridiculous decontamination scene, I knew this was movie was a mistake. Stopped watching after 45 minutes. For what this movie cost, it could have paid for a couple episodes of real sci-fi entertainment in the caliber of Dark Matter, The Expanse and Firefly. So in summary, booooooo...you guys suck. Find a different career and stop making movies.
Reading the reviews where more entertaining than the actual movie.
I made an account just to say this movie is pure utter trash. Whoever green lit this needs to be locked away so they don't allow another abomination like this movie to be made.
There is nothing positive I can say about this movie, Cosmic Sin. Poor acting. Rotten storyline. Overdone special effects. The required Netflix smoking scene. The whole movie sucks.

Near instantaneous space travel.

Pick up trucks.

Shotgun shells.

Parasite waring aliens.

Alien force fields.

1 bomb.

We win.

They lose.

End of story.

review_title: "All of our shots are lucky shots...."
review_detailed_main: I tried watching this. I really did. That woman doctor at the beginning with the dreadful lines and crap acting set the tone for the rest of the movie. Cool idea poorly executed rubbish script...

review_title: Low Caliber, Low Budget, Poorly Executed
review_detailed_main: The delivery of a LOT of the dialog is difficult to watch most of the time, mostly because it feels like out of context each time. Its like they didn't get any military experts on-set to provide guidance. It's supposed to be 500 hundred years from now and I'm watching kids playing soldier with awfully communication skills. The quick explanation of any of the technology also feels like NO expert was available. Star Trek from the 70's did a better job with First Contact than these guys. Only reason I keep watching is hope of improvement by the end, don't hold your breath. Bruce Willis is another reason I kept watching, if he wasn't in it I would not even take the time to write this review.

So I watched anti life. Wow that was a turkey. I had convinced myself Bruce wouldn't choose 2 turkeys in a year. But he did. The acting is awful. Bruce is fine in it, but he doesn't really hold the film together. The suits look like they've been made by a Blue Peter presenter and the aliens clearly look like dudes in capes. The special effects are ok I guess.
If you ever want to see how the editing of a movie can screw it up, watch this one. It could have been a good movie, but it's chopped to pieces.

You get actors such as Clint Eastwood, al Pacino, Robert deniro etc who have all carried in and chose food films to be in. Bruce Willis why oh why has he jus t fine from bad to worse shame on you taking an easy buck. And a career now that is dead.
People should to go to jail for making this movie.

review_title: The movie no one wants to be in.
review_detailed_main: I have the feeling that the producer/directors Were at several partys and got talking to all the people there who were drunk and said do you want to be in a film, and drunkenly went, yep sure why not, to be woken by a call 3 months later to be reminded they said yes.

review_title: Really bad. Among the worst movies I watched in 2021
review_detailed_main:
The idea was pretty cool, but it just came together so poorly I wish I'd turned it off.

Tropey in an extremely unfun way
Boring characters and story
Awkward music and acting
Dialogue was just awful


The whole thing felt like it was a big joke to everyone in the cast, that we weren't in on. It was 100% a cash grab for the studio and people involved.

Seems like Bruce was really needing the cash to do this pointless movie. I thought the first 10 minutes were nearly OK, but then it's like someone else took over directing for the rest of the movie. This has to be one of the worst films that Bruce has ever done.

Can't give it 1/2 a star!

review_title: Another cash-grab by the writers and Bruce
review_detailed_main:
This is just trash made by Edward Drake along with Corey Large for their partner-in-crime Bruce Willis. Edward and Corey have been dumping out piles of garbage for Bruce to act in for the last four years.

I called it too, the "funny guy" with a lot of bad dialog was one of the writers, Corey. If you've seen the movie already you know exactly which character I'm talking about. If you haven't seen it yet, you will know who this is immediately. Looking at IMDB, he writes himself into every movie they've done so far.

If you're looking for a bad movie to watch, this one is nice and painful for those who enjoy well thought-out stories. The visuals are fine. It's the dialog, plot, pacing, and costumes that will make you suffer, truly.

This movie is not "so bad that it's good", it's just bad.

review_title: Bruce Willis takes money over integrity.
review_detailed_main:
They must have paid Bruce Willis a good amount of money for him to actually agree to do this movie, or maybe he lost a bet. I suppose we will never know.

I've already put in more effort reviewing this movie than the writers, actors, and everyone else did making it, so there you have it.
If I was to say this was trying to be a Halo ripoff, that would be a compliment.
Go watch paint dry, it'll be more coherent and entertaining than this mess.

I don't even know where to begin. We're the actors even in the movie. Did they just sit in 2 rooms and speak lines into a mic as if they were annoyed to be getting a pay check. The amount of poor video quality, props, poor directing because, what you have a-list celebrity telling you "it looks good to me". I mean I'm glad this was free on Netflix and I did not see it anywhere I had to waste anything more then time. I feel bad Netflix had to prolly pay money to get this gem for us the stream. To the 50 people that made money on the movie. Congrats, to the millions of us suckers who had to watch it. Chalk it up as a bad meal.

review_title: When corporate people turn art into product
review_detailed_main: We all know about EFO and Randall Emett films but omg these Bondit people who keep churning these films out over and over just slapping names on re-tread films is killing the industry. I mean I get it, we want films to be made and maybe the studio space left a vaccum but this constant barrage of films that are "similar" to other films shot in 5-7 days with no prep no story is crazy! But when you can make money int he shadows like these guys do thats why you keep seeing 45 executive producers for a film shot in a weekend. Edward drake did 8 of these in a year-- 8!! HOW! Cosmic sin is another example of guys with no talent and access to daddys hedge funds funding films and taking photos on set to make them look important... sad really what they did to bruce.

I didn't watch the entire movie. I just couldn't take it anymore. Really bad plot with a lot of information thrown in at the beginning. It's movies like this that make second guess my Netflix subscription. Bruce, you can choose better movies to be in.
Come hanno fatto a convincere questo cast a girare questo film? Senza senso, senza storia, senza budget. Scene buttate giù a casaccio. Che pena.
Ok honestly, hmmmmm sums up this movie in every aspect. There is simply nothing positive or even neutral to say about this thing.

review_title: It makes a much sense as a harmonica in an echo chamber
review_detailed_main:
Disjointed storyline is not interesting.

Lame dialog is lame.

Physics fantasy coupled with very unrealistic soldiers is so disappointing.

Really ... no comments.

Like don't waste your time. There were moments, when I thought it must get better. But no....

review_title: I'm 41 and this is one of the worst films I've ever seen
review_detailed_main:
So much potential from the synopsis, but omg, this was so boring - nothing of note happened, everything was completely vague with no structure or development at all.

Bruce Willis is the star, but honestly, this is like a film you make if you've had your whole family kidnapped and threatened with death if you don't do it.

Completely, dull, flat, lacking in any development or depth. One of the worst films I've ever seen.

Avoid! You have been warned.

I have no words to adequately describe what an utter waste of time this movie is.

What a terrible movie.

review_title: Bruce Willis's NEW Movie is SO BAD It's BREAKING THE INTERNET!
review_detailed_main:
"Cosmic Sin" is a film that seems to exist in a cinematic black hole, a swirling vortex of bad acting, nonsensical plot, and special effects that look like they were crafted with a decade-old version of Blender. Bruce Willis, a shadow of his former action-hero self, sleepwalks through his role as General James Ford, a grizzled military man tasked with saving humanity from an alien threat. Honestly, it's almost painful to watch such a talented actor phone in a performance with such disinterest.

The problems with "Cosmic Sin" are numerous. The dialogue is clunky and exposition-heavy, often relying on tired sci-fi tropes and clichés. The characters are paper-thin, lacking any depth or motivation beyond shooting aliens and spouting cheesy one-liners. And the plot, oh, the plot! It's a convoluted mess that jumps between scenes with reckless abandon, leaving the audience bewildered and disoriented. One minute they're on a spaceship, the next they're teleporting to a random planet that looks suspiciously like a quarry in rural England.

But here's the thing: amidst all the chaos and absurdity, "Cosmic Sin" possesses a strange, almost hypnotic quality. It's like watching a train wreck in slow motion, you can't look away even though you know it's going to be a disaster. The film's sheer incompetence becomes a source of amusement, a testament to the depths of cinematic depravity that filmmakers can reach.

So, if you're in the mood for a truly terrible movie experience, one that will make you laugh, groan, and question the very fabric of reality, then "Cosmic Sin" is the perfect choice. Just grab some popcorn, gather your friends, and prepare to embark on a journey into the cinematic abyss. But be warned, you might need a strong drink afterwards to cleanse your palate.

review_title: Avoid this... Even if it's the LAST movie in the cosmos

Maybe COVID caused writing, filming, location, and acting issues?? I have literally been watching this movie off and on for 8 hours because I try to finish anything I start (personal issues). It's torture. Just don't. 😣😫😭

And the worst part, the movie supposed to be 500 years in the future, and somehow we still use yesterday's technology.

A total waste of time.

One of the worst movies I've watched in years. Boring script that made no sense. The actors looked as if they were as bored with making the movie as the audience. Whoever signed off on making this needs to find another line of work.

review_title: You know how when you say a movie is bad someone will ask if you can do better?
I guess Bruce Willis lost a bet?
review_detailed_main: This thing is a mess. Hard to follow even with all the sci fi cliches. And the "aliens" look like Star Wars cosplayers. I'm assuming Bruce Willis either lost a bet or owed a favor to get dragged into this mess. Avoid this at all costs.

I love Bruce Willis and I love Sci Fi, so you would think this would be hard for me to dislike. It wasn't, it wasn't hard for me to dislike. This is the most phoned in movie I have ever seen. From the writers, to the actors, to the sound track. Absolutely terrible...

The film is so poorly made as if the director was competing to make the script as bad as possible. There is no comprehensible introduction, there are too many unnecessary actions of the film. Important scenes are in the form of a moment, and long boring scenes last like an eternity. The film does not hold the viewer's attention.

The music in the film is terrible, the Space Alliance seems to not exist. A very bad script for a movie made in 2021. Films from 1980 have a better script. I'm writing this review as well as the scenes in the movie. Perhaps the author was inspired by the films Space Soldiers and Armageddon when writing the script.

review_title: Jason X meets Riddick. Why not a Fifth Element 2?
review_detailed_main:
The characters aren't relatable. Camera angles are terrible. I swear most action movies since the 2000's are solely based on getting the camera as close and shaky as possible to disorient the viewer.

Creating convincing action scenes doesn't require CGI every time, all the time. Believe it or not, some of the most loved movies of all time had wide camera angles that didn't change every 0.3 seconds. Like Die Hard...

Bruce Willis already did 5th Element. Unless you wanted to try to beat it, this is a waste of time. To involve him and make him the prime poster cover when really he's just a cameo most of the movie, is poor salesmanship. You would have been better to try a Fifth Element 2 than this Jason X meets Riddick.

The directing was just awful, the lines were COMPLETELY unbelieveable from the start. The action was garbage mostly because of the terrible camera angles and frequent changes.

I don't direct movies, but I know good ones from bad ones, and no offense to one of my fav actors Bruce Willis.... but this movie is not worth watching.
Where to begin? Sloppy writing. Amateurish CGI in spots, a mostly incomprehensible ending, phone in performances.... skip it, folks, look for something better.

The only sin here is the lack of any cohesive thought in writing producing and directing this awful movie. Sad to see good actors and actresses get handed a script of crap. There is.evidence that the writers may have read Starship Troopers by Robert A. Heinlein (GOAT of SciFi authors) and used his Nova bomb as describe in Starship Troopers 3: Marauder and Starship Troopers: Traitor of Mars; "There has been controversy on Earth over the use of the Q Bomb: Religious fanatics say that the Federation shouldn't decide what planet lives and dies; politicians don't bother; and military officials think that since the Bugs don't use a Q Bomb, why shouldn't they?" This sad movie attempts to be part HALO, part StarShip Troopers, part Astronaut's Wife, part I don't know what the Fubar. It rambles and stumbles it's way across the screen like an alien bug shot so full of plot holes that it's raining blood and bad lines till it finally collapses in a fit of flatulence, writhing on the theater floor, spilled popcorn and milk duds scattering in all directions, like sparks from a broken dynamo. The green screen, is cheep, the FX only add to the unrealism, there is no sense of immersiveness, and Bruce delivers his worst performance since Hudson Hawk. Spare your eyes and ears and move on from this cosmic cosplayed out weirdness.

I am a fan of B grade sci fi but this caught me by surprise like farting and realising it's not a fart. The biggest sin here is the directing. I cannot believe someone actually funded this project let alone let it be published. This is one of those movies that can end a career it is that bad. Bruce Willis is in it yes.. but I was sure he could act ? Right ? And then there are a few B grade actors as well as some who look like other actors. The scripting was perhaps the worst I have ever seen. They clearly had a budget so why not make a half decent movie ? This is fighting for top ten of worst movies ever watched and I only let it get to the end to see what happened and even then I regret it. Watch at your own peril.

I wish I had a mallet to smash the gong.... kicking the whole movie set off my tv. I'm sitting here waiting for something to happen and get better. I couldn't take this bs and stupid dialogue and stupid music like something was suspenseful when it wasn't. I can see why Bruce sucks now. Every flick he's signed onto since die hard has sucked. I thought this was an alien flick not some vampire zombie movie. Wth? What a pos movie. "Go go go" or "move move move" when getting shot at.....lmao..Believe all the 1s. They are all the things to be looking forward to if you pluck up the courage to watch this travesty. review_title: Bad all the way around. SPOILER
In the 2500s people inexplicably drive current-era cars
review_detailed_main: If you like plot holes, cliches, corny dialogue that is not funny, and some pretty good special effects...this might be a movie for you. This movie is as dislikable as most of its characters and as confused as most of the actors seem to be.

review_title: A must see movie - or else you'd never believe how truly bad it is.
review_detailed_main:
We had hoped this would be so bad it's good, but no. Every single element from the script to the acting to the lines - painfully cringe worthy awful.

Did Bruce lose a bet or something?

My wife just told me she wants a personal apology from him for subjecting her to this.

Fortunately, after watching this we can now both start collecting disability as we've said goodbye to countless brain cells.

First, I saw Bruce and I was like, WOOHOO another alike awesome movie like Armageddon!

Soon, I was like, WHAT!?

I mean literately like WHAT?!

Like WHAT, the Q bomb is made with a wood screw?!

Like WHAT, you can flight in outer space but your suite is not a fully enclosed suite?

Like WHAT, you can fall in atmosphere without burning like an meteorite?

After a wile i was watching this mybe 15-20 minutes... i skip to the end see if they put the good stuff at the end... i was wrong... looks like a bad fan made movie for youtube... people who made this movie should be shame by themselfs..... what a garbage movie.
No need to waste time writing anything....movie wasted more than enough time of my life...

It's a B movie. It's made to kill time. It could've been much worse ("Monsters of Man", anyone?)... Yes, the actors seemingly didn't want to be there, and the music was on the opposite side from Zimmer... But it's a B movie, okay?!

On a bright side, other than presence of a token "female power" character with wielding a BFG, there's no virtue signaling whatsoever, no preaching or lecturing... That alone gets 3 extra stars from me. So, 4 in total. Fair enough?

review_title: Makes you wonder what could have been
review_detailed_main:
A strong opening act shows cracks that eventually become chasms of mediocrity. The concept is quite good and really feels like the sort of thing you dreamed up in your nerd-driven fantasy of what could happen in a cool sci-fi storyline, but when the budget gets you Bruce "Anything for a Buck" Willis and a bunch of special effects worthy of mid-90s SyFy TV shows, you end up feeling like you've just been lied to. Frank Grillo gets top billing but is on screen for about 5 minutes. Mid to late movie direction is particularly poor, as you sometimes enter the zone of "spooky ghostly characters in the dark" and dudes in plastic outfits that bear no resemblance or relation to the interesting type of antagonist encountered in the first act.

The redeeming quality is that it makes you think about what a cool story this could have been if it had a giant budget. It could have been longer, more fleshed out, and not look like half the movie takes place in a garage.
Watched for Bruce Willis, who almost sounded like Vin Diesel one-liners throughout the movie. Acting was not credible at all for everyone. The CGI was probably the only part worth watching.

Frank Grillo was making some great decisions with projects. He has a very likable personality about him in almost every movie. He's very talented and looked to be on the verge of potentially being a leading actor. Well, something has happened as of late because this is like the 3rd DUD he chose. I literally can't believe he would say yes to be involved in such garbage. Yeah Bruce Willis is long in the tooth but come on, it's Bruce Willis. Well some years ago he decided for some strange reason it's better to be in horrible movies. Why?? Frank Grillo better change his direction fast before there's no turning back. I'm afraid to say it could be over for Bruce.

review_title: 10 minutes in and turned it off
review_detailed_main:
Bruce Willis will take any acting job seriously he will. To be fair, I can't give a review since I didn't even make it past 10 minutes. What happens in the first 10 minutes?

A small bomb lands in a forest. People talk in front of a Walmart parking lot. We see a dive bar with good ol aluminum siding on the outside. The patrons are dressed in flannel shirts. People pull out pistols during a fight. This is not a scene from 1982...this movie is supposed to be 2542 or whatever date that is 500 years from now.

According to the writers, rednecks will survive through the next 5 centuries. Pitiful start and I didn't care to continue with it. I hope you value your time more than Bruce Willis. Did the writers even bother
I can't believe Frank Grillo starred in this pile. It wasn't even up to the SyFy channel quality, which isn't hard to achieve. So so bad.
